intro: Herpestis ovata, commonly known as the oval leaf herb, is a perennial herb native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. The plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
